rules: Rule1: Under the condition that Dr. Smith recommends surgery, if the examination of the dog has been completed during the checkup, then whenever the dog not arriving at the clinic does not lead to the dog needing treatment with medication, it follows that the dog requires surgery for neutering.
Rule2: Either Dr. Smith recommends surgery or Dr. Jones recommends surgery.

Rule3: Should surgery be scheduled for the dog on Monday, then provided that the examination of the dog has been completed during the checkup, if the dog not arriving at the clinic does not result in the dog needing treatment with medication, the dog requires surgery for neutering.
Rule4: If the x-ray machine has an equipment malfunction, then the x-ray machine is available.

Rule5: Either an alternative procedure, ultrasound, is available, or if it is not the case that the x-ray machine having an equipment malfunction implies the x-ray machine is not available leads to the technician John being called, then maintenance has not been scheduled for the x-ray machine.
Rule6: Under the condition that the dog needs treatment with medication, the dog has the condition of fleas.
Rule7: Provided that treatment has been approved by the owner, treatment has been approved by the insurance.
Rule8: If there is a legal issue with the consent form, a lawsuit has been filed by the owner against the clinic.
Rule9: Assuming a complaint has been made by the owner, it is not the case that a lawsuit has been filed by the owner against the clinic.
Rule10: A complaint has been made by the owner or the complaint has been escalated by the owner.
Rule11: Under the condition that an investigation has been opened by the medical board, the license of Dr. Smith has been revoked.
Rule12: Provided that an investigation has been opened by the medical board, it is not the case that the license of Dr. Smith has been revoked.
Rule13: If the cat has been admitted to the clinic, then the dog has been admitted to the clinic.
Rule14: Either the cat has been admitted to the clinic, or if the dog not arriving at the clinic implies the dog does not need treatment with medication, then the dog requires surgery for neutering.
Rule15: In the case that payment was made by the owner using a card, it is not the case that payment was made by the owner using cash.
Rule16: Should payment be confirmed for the owner in the transaction, then payment was made by the owner using a card.
Rule17: If it is not the case that Dr. Jones recommending surgery leads to surgery being scheduled for the dog on Monday, then the x-ray machine has an equipment malfunction.

Rule18: Under the condition that it is not the case that the x-ray machine having an equipment malfunction implies the x-ray machine is not available, it is not the case that the technician John has been called.
Rule19: In the event that it is not the case that consent given by the owner leads to treatment being approved by the owner, there is a legal issue with the consent form.

Rule20: If it is not the case that the complaint being escalated by the owner implies a lawsuit has not been filed by the owner against the clinic, an investigation has been opened by the medical board.

Rule21: Provided that it is not the case that the x-ray machine having an equipment malfunction implies the x-ray machine is not available does not lead to the technician John being called, maintenance has been scheduled for the x-ray machine.

Rule22: In the case that it is not the case that the dog not arriving at the clinic implying the dog does not need treatment with medication, which then implies the dog requires surgery for neutering, does not lead to billing being processed for the owner regarding the invoice, payment was made by the owner using cash.

Rule23: Assuming it is not the case that the dog not arriving at the clinic implying the dog does not need treatment with medication, which then implies the dog requires surgery for neutering, does not lead to billing being processed for the owner regarding the invoice, payment has been confirmed for the owner in the transaction.

Rule24: In the event that it is not the case that the dog not arriving at the clinic implies the dog does not need treatment with medication, which then implies the dog requires surgery for neutering, it is not the case that billing has been processed for the owner regarding the invoice.
Rule25: Should the dog not arriving at the clinic imply the dog does not need treatment with medication, consent has been given by the owner.
facts: Fact1: The examination of the dog has been completed during the checkup.
Fact2: It is not the case that the dog has the condition of fleas.
Fact3: It is not the case that an alternative procedure, ultrasound, is available.
Fact4: It is not the case that treatment has been approved by the insurance.
Fact5: It is not the case that the dog requires surgery for neutering.
Fact6: It is not the case that the dog has been admitted to the clinic.

question: The dog has arrived at the clinic.
